name: everywhere
content:

A2 to, at, or in all places or the whole of a place: His children go everywhere with him. Everywhere looks so grey and depressing in winter. I looked everywhere for my keys. Reasonable people everywhere will be outraged by this atrocity.everywhere else We had to stay in the sleaziest hotel in town because everywhere else (= all other places) was fully booked.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pipe burst and water was spraying everywhere.I hate flying so I go everywhere by road or rail.We looked for her everywhere, but she was nowhere to be found.His mother spoils him terribly and drives him around everywhere.What I like about Cambridge is that there's so much open space - there are parks and commons everywhere.
